unnormalised: Okay, folks, buckle up because the Indian auto scene is heating up with a flurry of new vehicle launches! It feels like every other week there's a new car or bike hitting the market, vying for our attention (and, more importantly, our hard-earned rupees).
normalised: Okay, folks, buckle up because the Indian auto scene is heating up with a flurry of new vehicle launches! It feels like every other week there's a new car or bike hitting the market, vying for our attention (and, more importantly, our hard-earned rupees).

unnormalised: Just last month, Maruti Suzuki launched the much-anticipated next-gen Alto 800. Remember the iconic "Kitna deti hai?" ads? Well, this one promises even better fuel efficiency – supposedly around 25 kmpl. Perfect for navigating the chaotic streets of Mumbai, no?
normalised: Just last month, Maruti Suzuki launched the much-anticipated next-gen Alto eight hundred. Remember the iconic "Kitna deti hai?" ads? Well, this one promises even better fuel efficiency – supposedly around twenty five kilometer per liter. Perfect for navigating the chaotic streets of Mumbai, no?

unnormalised: Then there's the Tata Punch EV, a mini-SUV that’s giving serious vibes of the Land Rover styling. Available in multiple variants starting at an approx price of Rs. 10 Lakhs, it could be a game-changer in the EV segment. Imagine cruising down Marine Drive in complete silence!
normalised: Then there's the Tata Punch E V, a mini-S U V that’s giving serious vibes of the Land Rover styling. Available in multiple variants starting at an approximate price of rupees ten Lakhs, it could be a game-changer in the E V segment. Imagine cruising down Marine Drive in complete silence!

unnormalised: Mahindra also announced some serious advancements for their Thar lineup; with a 5-door version rumored for early next year. This would be great for all those family trips to Rajasthan we always talk about!
normalised: Mahindra also announced some serious advancements for their Thar lineup; with a five-door version rumored for early next year. This would be great for all those family trips to Rajasthan we always talk about!

unnormalised: Speaking of electric, Ola Electric is aggressively pushing its scooter range. They recently slashed prices and added some new features. I heard that the IIT Delhi campus is now practically overrun with Ola scooters – talk about a student favourite!
normalised: Speaking of electric, Ola Electric is aggressively pushing its scooter range. They recently slashed prices and added some new features. I heard that the I I T Delhi campus is now practically overrun with Ola scooters – talk about a student favourite!

unnormalised: But it's not just cars and scooters. Royal Enfield continues to dominate the premium bike market, with spy shots of their upcoming Himalayan 450 constantly surfacing online. The anticipation is palpable! Remember that chase scene in "Dhoom"? Hopefully, this Himalayan will be as versatile, but a bit more reliable.
normalised: But it's not just cars and scooters. Royal Enfield continues to dominate the premium bike market, with spy shots of their upcoming Himalayan four hundred and fifty constantly surfacing online. The anticipation is palpable! Remember that chase scene in "Dhoom"? Hopefully, this Himalayan will be as versatile, but a bit more reliable.

unnormalised: With so many options, choosing the right vehicle can feel like a Herculean task! But hey, that's what test drives and research are for, right? Happy driving, and may your journey be smooth (and traffic-free)!
normalised: With so many options, choosing the right vehicle can feel like a Herculean task! But hey, that's what test drives and research are for, right? Happy driving, and may your journey be smooth (and traffic-free)!
